meanings.definition: To waste time or act aimlessly.
meanings.sent1: She footlers around the house all day, never getting anything done.
meanings.sent2: Don't footlers too much or you won't finish your homework on time.
meanings.sent3: The cat likes to footlers with a ball of yarn, making a mess everywhere.
meanings.sent4: His mind footlers from one thought to another, never focusing on anything.
meanings.sent5: The children footlers in the playground, enjoying their carefree time.

meanings.definition: A person who wastes time or acts aimlessly.
meanings.sent1: He is known as the office footlers, always chatting instead of working.
meanings.sent2: The footlers in the park seemed lost in their own world.
meanings.sent3: The footlers at the party kept changing topics, never staying on one conversation.
meanings.sent4: She felt like a footlers in a sea of busy bees, unsure of what to do next.
meanings.sent5: The footlers wandered through the streets, enjoying the simple pleasures of life.
